content.raw:
Hello Daniel:

It looks like a removal in the namespace for newer boost libraries. For our ubuntu releases and testing system we are using "precise" (boost-1.42) and "quantal" (boost-1.49). The continuous integration tools did not show any error with respect to this.

I was not able to find any explicit comment about namespace deprecation in boost documentation and [releases](http://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_53_0/libs/filesystem/doc/release_history.html) but since 1.50 version 2 of filesystem was removed which probably has remove the 3 namespace.

I will look for a proper solution for this.

Hello Daniel:

It looks like a removal in the namespace for newer boost libraries. For our ubuntu releases and testing system we are using "precise" (boost-1.42) and "quantal" (boost-1.49). The continuous integration tools did not show any error with respect to this.

I was not able to find any explicit comment about namespace deprecation in boost documentation and releases but since 1.50 version 2 of filesystem was removed which probably has remove the 3 namespace.

I will look for a proper solution for this.
